First subheading

Content of the paragraph. The first paragraph of a section has no indent. A paragraph (from the Ancient Greek παράγραφος paragraphos, "to write beside" or "written beside") is a group of sentences with one topic. It is also a self-contained unit of a discourse in writing dealing with a particular point or idea. A paragraph consists of more than one sentence. Though not required by the syntax of any language, paragraphs are usually an expected part of formal writing, used to organize longer prose. (Wikipedia)

Content of the paragraph: the paragraphs following the first paragraph of a section have an indent.
